001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003import squidpony.annotation.Beta;
004
005/**
006 * Based on <a href="http://extremelearning.com.au/isotropic-blue-noise-point-sets/">Martin Roberts' blog post about
007 * blue noise point sets</a>, this class generates "balanced" permutations of a specific size with good performance.
008 * It may be added to later to include the rest of that blog post.
009 */
010@Beta
011public class BalancedPermutations {
012        public final int size;
013        private final int halfSize;
014        private final int[] delta, targets;
015        /**
016         * Can be any long.
017         */
018        private long stateA;
019        /**
020         * Must be odd.
021         */
022        private long stateB;
023
024        public BalancedPermutations(){
025                this(16,
026                                (long) ((Math.random() - 0.5) * 0x10000000000000L)
027                                                ^ (long) (((Math.random() - 0.5) * 2.0) * 0x8000000000000000L),
028                                (long) ((Math.random() - 0.5) * 0x10000000000000L)
029                                                ^ (long) (((Math.random() - 0.5) * 2.0) * 0x8000000000000000L));
030        }
031        public BalancedPermutations(int size, long stateA, long stateB)
032        {
033                this.size = size;
034                this.halfSize = size >>> 1;
035                delta = new int[size];
036                targets = new int[size];
037                this.stateA = stateA;
038                this.stateB = stateB | 1;
039        }
040
041        /**
042         * It's a weird RNG. Returns a slightly-biased pseudo-random int between 0 inclusive and bound exclusive. The bias comes from
043         * not completely implementing Daniel Lemire's fastrange algorithm, but it should only be relevant for huge bounds. The number
044         * generator itself passes PractRand without anomalies, has a state size of 127 bits, and a period of 2 to the 127.
045         * This generator will probably be added to SquidLib as "GearRNG."
046         * @param bound upper exclusive bound
047         * @return an int between 0 (inclusive) and bound (exclusive)
048         */
049        private int nextIntBounded (int bound) {
050                final long s = (stateA += 0xC6BC279692B5C323L);
051                final long z = ((s < 0x800000006F17146DL) ? stateB : (stateB += 0x9479D2858AF899E6L)) * (s ^ s >>> 31);
052                return (int)(bound * ((z ^ z >>> 25) & 0xFFFFFFFFL) >>> 32);
053        }
054
055        private static void swap(int[] arr, int pos1, int pos2) {
056                final int tmp = arr[pos1];
057                arr[pos1] = arr[pos2];
058                arr[pos2] = tmp;
059        }
060
061        /**
062         * Fisher-Yates and/or Knuth shuffle, done in-place on an int array.
063         * @param elements will be modified in-place by a relatively fair shuffle
064         */
065        private void shuffleInPlace(int[] elements) {
066                final int size = elements.length;
067                for (int i = size; i > 1; i--) {
068                        swap(elements, i - 1, nextIntBounded(i));
069                }
070        }
071
072        /**
073         * Fills {@code items} with a balanced permutation from 0 to {@code size - 1}. The length of {@code items} must be
074         * at least {@code size}. This may take a while if size is large; half a second is reasonable for when size is 48,
075         * with smaller sizes taking much less time and larger ones taking much more.
076         * @param items an int array which will be modified in-place
077         */
078        public void fill(final int[] items) {
079                if(items == null || items.length < size) return;
080                BIG_LOOP:
081                while (true) {
082                        for (int i = 0; i < halfSize; i++) {
083                                delta[i] = i + 1;
084                                delta[i + halfSize] = ~i;
085                        }
086                        shuffleInPlace(delta);
087                        for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
088                                targets[i] = i;
089                        }
090                        targets[items[0] = nextIntBounded(size)] = -1;
091                        for (int i = 1; i < size; i++) {
092                                int d = 0;
093                                for (int j = 0; j < size; j++) {
094                                        d = delta[j];
095                                        if (d == 0) continue;
096                                        int t = items[i - 1] + d;
097                                        if (t >= 0 && t < size && targets[t] != -1) {
098                                                items[i] = t;
099                                                targets[t] = -1;
100                                                delta[j] = 0;
101                                                break;
102                                        } else d = 0;
103                                }
104                                if (d == 0) continue BIG_LOOP;
105                        }
106                        int d = items[0] - items[size - 1];
107                        for (int j = 0; j < size; j++) {
108                                if (d == delta[j]) {
109                                        return; // found a valid balanced permutation
110                                }
111                        }
112                }
113        }
114        
115        public GreasedRegion rotatedGrid(){
116                int size2 = size * size;
117                GreasedRegion region = new GreasedRegion(size2, size2);
118                int px, py = 0;
119                for (int x = 0; x < size; x++) {
120                        px = size - 1 + x * size;
121                        for (int y = 0; y < size; y++) {
122                                region.insert(px--, py + y * size);
123                        }
124                        py++;
125                }
126                return region;
127        }
128
129        public GreasedRegion shuffledGrid(){
130                int[] xPerm = new int[size], yPerm = new int[size];
131                fill(xPerm);
132                fill(yPerm);
133                int size2 = size * size;
134                GreasedRegion region = new GreasedRegion(size2, size2);
135                int px, py;
136                for (int x = 0; x < size; x++) {
137                        px = size - 1;
138                        py = yPerm[x];
139                        for (int y = 0; y < size; y++) {
140                                region.insert(px - xPerm[y] + xPerm[x] * size, py + yPerm[y] * size);
141                        }
142                }
143                return region;
144        }
145
146        public GreasedRegion shuffledGridMultiple(int repeats){
147                int[] xPerm = new int[size], yPerm = new int[size], rxPerm = new int[size], ryPerm = new int[size];
148                repeats = (repeats + size - 1) % size;
149                fill(xPerm);
150                fill(yPerm);
151                fill(rxPerm);
152                fill(ryPerm);
153                int size2 = size * size;
154                GreasedRegion region = new GreasedRegion(size2, size2);
155                int px, py, rx, ry;
156                for (int r = 0; r <= repeats; r++) {
157                        rx = rxPerm[r];
158                        ry = ryPerm[r];
159                        for (int x = 0; x < size; x++) {
160                                px = size - 1;
161                                py = yPerm[x];
162                                for (int y = 0; y < size; y++) {
163                                        region.insert(px - xPerm[y] + xPerm[(x + rx) % size] * size, py + yPerm[(y + ry) % size] * size);
164                                }
165                        }
166                }
167                return region;
168        }
169}
